intro: Rogiera stenosiphon, commonly known as the narrow-siphon rogeria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
